heading: # Sparklines
headingText:
The sparkline component can be used to create simple graphs, like GitHub's contribution chart.

Any [SVG attribute](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute) may be used in addition to the ones listed below.

usage.desc: A sparkline is a tiny chart that provides a visual representation of data.

playground.desc: The sparkline component comes in 2 variations, **trend**(default) and **bar**. Each support a multitude of options for customizing the look and feel of the sparkline.

heart-rate.heading: ### Take a break
heart-rate.desc: For concise information, a complete chart might be overkill. Using a trend line with gradient provides enough detail for the user without showing too much information.

dashboard-card.heading: ### Dashboard card
dashboard-card.desc: The `v-sparkline` component pairs nicely with `v-card` and `v-sheet` to create customized information cards, perfect for admin dashboards. Here we use custom labels to provide additional context for the sparkline.

sales-card.heading: ### Custom labels
sales-card.desc: By providing a **label** slot, we are able to modify the displayed content adding a dollar sign ($). This slot is **_exclusively_** for text content. For more information on the svg `<text>` element, [navigate here](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Element/text).

fill.heading: ### Fill
fill.desc: You can create a `v-sparkline` with fill using the `fill` property.

props.autoDraw: Trace the length of the line when first rendered
props.autoDrawDuration: Amount of time (in ms) to run the trace animation
props.autoDrawEasing: The easing function to use for the trace animation
props.autoLineWidth: Automatically expand bars to use space eficiently
props.fill: Using the **fill** property allows you to better customize the look and feel of your sparkline.
props.gradient: An array of colors to use as a linear-gradient
props.gradientDirection: The direction the gradient should run
props.height: Height of the SVG trendline or bars
props.labels: An array of string labels that correspond to the same index as its data counterpart
props.lineWidth: The thickness of the line, in px
props.padding: Low `smooth` or high `line-width` values may result in cropping, increase padding to compensate
props.showLabels: Show labels below each data point
props.smooth: Number of px to use as a corner radius. `true` defaults to 8, `false` is 0
props.type: Choose between a trendline or bars
props.width: Width of the SVG trendline or bars
